# Present Perfect Simple

**Rule**  Connects a past action to the present; the *result* is what matters.

**Example (song lyric)**  —  *U2 – “I Still Haven’t Found What I’m Looking For”*.

{{< video src="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=e3-5YC_oHjE" title="U2 – I Still Haven’t Found What I’m Looking For" width=640 height=360 >}}

> *I **haven’t found** what I’m looking for.* – Present perfect marks an unfinished search whose impact is still felt now.
